medium: Gelatin silver print with handwritten text
creditline: Bequest of Duane E. Wilder, Class of 1951

makers.displaydate: born 1932, McKeesport, PA; active New York, NY
makers.displaymaker: Duane Michals, born 1932, McKeesport, PA; active New York, NY

texts.textentryhtml: Michals worked in commercial photography for a number of years, shooting for Esquire and Mademoiselle and covering the filming of The Great Gatsby for Vogue in 1984. Absent a studio, he took portraits of people in their environments, which was a departure from the dominant method of the time in the hands of Richard Avedon and Irving Penn. Once an outlier, Michals has since inspired artists from Jim Goldberg to Cindy Sherman to countless others who stage, scribble over, or paint on their photographs.
texts.remarks: The Eclectic Eye: A Tribute to Duane Wilder

texts.textentryhtml: The artist. Acquired by Duane E. Wilder (1929-2017); bequeathed to the Princeton University Art Museum, 2018.
